intro: Dasystephana puberula, commonly known as the hairy stephania, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its climbing habit and compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are typically clustered in axillary inflorescences. Its stems are covered with fine, hairy pubescence, giving it its common name. The botanical interest in Dasystephana puberula lies in its unique morphology and potential medicinal properties.
